oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Methodical Problems in Organic Farming Research
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schäfer, Winfried
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Research methodology and philosophy
Indicators and other value-laden measures
Systems research and participatory research
Specific methods
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Workshop presentation with particular focus on values, transferability and praxis relevance of organic farming research. Examples from agricultural engineering lead to the conclusion, that prototype farming, goal oriented project management, participative decision making and funding, coaching of co-operation, and coaching of conflict management may enhance long term, holistic and interdisciplinary research.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schäfer, Winfried (2002) Methodical Problems in Organic Farming Research. Speech at: Research Seminar "Approaches of research on organic agri-food systems", Mikkeli, Finland, 12.-13. December 2002.
